sections.heading: As used in ss. 448.101-448.105, the term:(1)“Appropriate governmental agency” means any agency of government charged with the enforcement of laws, rules, or regulations governing an activity, policy, or practice of an employer
sections.text: (2)“Employee” means a person who performs services for and under the cont

sections.heading: An employer may not take any retaliatory personnel action against an employee because the employee has:(1)Disclosed, or threatened to disclose, to any appropriate governmental agency, under oath, in writing, an activity, policy, or practice of the employer that is in violation of a law, rule, or reg
sections.text: An employer may not take any retaliatory personnel action against an employee because the employee has:(1)Disclosed, or threatened to disclose, to any appropriate governmental agency, under oath, in writing, an activity, policy, or practice of the employer that is in violation of a law, rule, or regulation. However, this subsection does not apply unless the employee has, in writing, brought the activity, policy, or practice to the attention of a supervisor or the employer and has afforded the employer a reasonable opportunity to correct the activity, policy, or practice.(2)Provided information to, or testified before, any appropriate governmental agency, person, or entity conducting an investigation, hearing, or inquiry into an alleged violation of a law, rule, or regulation by the employer.(3)Objected to, or refused to participate in, any activity, policy, or practice of the employer which is in violation of a law, rule, or regulation.History.—s. 5, ch. 91-285.
